baseline: Treatment suggestions are posited for the mental_health practitioner working with individuals and/or couples.
high_intensity: Urgent treatment suggestions are strongly posited for the mental_health practitioner working with distressed individuals and/or couples.
low_intensity: Basic treatment suggestions are posited for the mental_health practitioner working with individuals and/or couples.

baseline: This study compares both of them, in terms of their ability to predict various well-being outcomes (i.e. general mental_health, physical well-being, and job satisfaction).
high_intensity: This study intensely compares both of them, in terms of their ability to predict various severe well-being outcomes (i.e. general mental_health, poor physical well-being, and low job satisfaction).
low_intensity: This study compares both of them, in terms of their ability to predict various mild well-being outcomes (i.e. general mental_health, physical well-being, and job satisfaction).

baseline: The current national COPMI project has been initiated to promote better mental_health outcomes for children of parents with a mental_illness, especially by providing information and good practice guidance for services and people in the community who work with these families and their children.
high_intensity: The current national COPMI project has been initiated to promote critical mental_health outcomes for children of parents with a severe mental_illness, especially by providing urgent information and exemplary practice guidance for services and people in the community who work with these families and their vulnerable children.
low_intensity: The current national COPMI project has been initiated to promote improved mental_health outcomes for children of parents with a mild mental_illness, especially by providing information and advisable practice guidance for services and people in the community who work with these families and their children.

baseline: Previous research has indicated that individuals afflicted with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) have a very low rate of seeking help from mental_health professionals.
high_intensity: Previous research has indicated that individuals tormented by obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) have an alarmingly low rate of seeking help from mental_health professionals.
low_intensity: Previous research has indicated that individuals with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) have a modest rate of seeking help from mental_health professionals.

baseline: Although there is a widespread desire to increase patient involvement in treatment decisions, which advance directives could possibly help to realise, they may also have unwanted consequences for mental_health services and individuals.
high_intensity: Although there is a widespread desire to increase patient involvement in treatment decisions, which advance directives could potentially help to realize, they may also have severe and unintended consequences for precarious mental_health services and individuals.
low_intensity: Although there is a widespread desire to increase patient involvement in treatment decisions, which advance directives could possibly help to realize, they may also have minor side effects for mental_health services and individuals.

baseline: Women with mental_health problems, irrespective of indicator used, had higher levels of sickness absence than women without mental_health problems.
high_intensity: Women with severe mental_health problems, irrespective of indicator used, had significantly higher levels of sickness absence than women without debilitating mental_health problems.
low_intensity: Women with mild mental_health problems, irrespective of indicator used, had slightly higher levels of sickness absence than women without mental_health problems.
